name: Abstract Strategy
description: Games with minimal luck and no hidden information, focusing purely on player strategy and tactics.

name: Area Control
description: Players compete to dominate specific areas on the board, often through strategic placement or combat.

name: Campaign/Legacy
description: Games that evolve over multiple sessions, with changes carrying over from game to game.

name: Deckbuilding
description: Players build a deck of cards during gameplay to gain more powerful combinations and abilities.

name: Dungeon Crawler
description: Players explore maps, fight monsters, and gather loot, often in a fantasy setting.

name: Worker Placement
description: Players place workers on limited action spaces to gain resources or perform tasks.

name: Tile Placement
description: Players place tiles to build or expand a map or territory in strategic ways.

name: Economic
description: Games focused on money management, markets, and resource optimization.

name: Engine Building
description: Players develop combinations of components that generate increasing returns over time.

name: Memory
description: Games that challenge players to remember previously revealed or hidden information.

name: Party Games
description: Games designed for large groups, emphasizing fun, interaction, and humor over strategy.

name: Family Games
description: Accessible games suitable for all ages, often easy to learn and quick to play.

name: Word Games
description: Games that involve vocabulary, spelling, or wordplay as core mechanics.

name: Real-Time
description: Games where players act simultaneously or under time pressure without turns.

name: Push Your Luck
description: Players decide how far to push their advantage, risking loss for greater reward.

name: Adventure
description: Narrative-driven games where players explore, encounter events, and progress through a story.

name: Horror
description: Games designed to evoke fear, suspense, or survival themes, often with dramatic tension.

name: Asymmetric
description: Players have different abilities, roles, or objectives, often creating uneven starting positions.

name: Cooperative
description: Players work together toward a shared goal, winning or losing as a team.

name: Science Fiction
description: Games set in futuristic or space-based settings, often involving technology or interstellar conflict.

name: Fantasy
description: Games set in magical or mythical worlds with fantastical creatures or powers.

name: Historical
description: Games based on or inspired by real historical events, settings, or figures.

name: Wargame
description: Games focused on military conflict, tactics, and battlefield control.

name: 4X
description: Games that involve exploring, expanding, exploiting, and exterminating, often in a large map or galaxy.

name: Negotiation
description: Games where players must bargain, trade, or make deals with each other to achieve their goals.

name: Card Game
description: Games primarily played with cards as the main component, often involving hand management.

name: Miniatures
description: Games centered around painted or unpainted miniature figures, often involving measuring movement and detailed combat on terrain-based maps.

name: Social

name: Logic

name: Racing

name: Timing

name: Set Collection
description: Games where players gather specific groups of items or cards to score points or trigger effects based on matching traits or patterns.

name: Puzzle

name: Route Building

name: Network Building

name: Trick-Taking
description: Card games where players play one card per round (a trick) and aim to win based on suit or value rules.

name: Social
description: Games that prioritize interaction, roleplay, and player dynamics over rigid mechanics, often best with large groups.
